summaryText: Wow, what a powerful message from Pastor Travis Hearn about not being a 'bougie believer'! PT breaks down how many Christians approach faith with convenience and selfishness instead of true servanthood. He challenges us to stop being consumers and start being contributors in God's kingdom. The sermon hits hard with practical ways to live out our faith: serving selflessly, giving generously, and living sacrificially. Pastor Travis uses humor and real-life stories to drive home the point that true joy comes from giving, not getting. Can you imagine how different our churches and communities would look if we all took this message to heart? He reminds us that Jesus didn't come to be served, but to serve - and we're called to do the same. The most eye-opening moment? When he reveals that if 100% of Impact Church members tithed for just 12 months, they could build a $100 million arena in cash! This isn't just about money, it's about transforming our hearts from self-centered to Christ-centered.
mainPoints: Stop being a 'bougie believer' who only serves when convenient
True joy comes from giving, not getting
Serve selflessly, give generously, live sacrificially

versesMentioned.text: You are the light of the world. A town built on a hill cannot be hidden. Neither do people light a lamp and put it under a bowl. Instead they put it on its stand, and it gives light to everyone in the house. In the same way, let your light shine before others, that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven.
Do nothing out of selfish ambition or vain conceit. Rather, in humility value others above yourselves, not looking to your own interests but each of you to the interests of the others.
A tithe of everything from the land, whether grain from the soil or fruit from the trees, belongs to the Lord; it is holy to the Lord.

'Will a mere mortal rob God? Yet you rob me. But you ask, 'How are we robbing you?' In tithes and offerings. You are under a curse—your whole nation—because you are robbing me. Bring the whole tithe into the storehouse, that there may be food in my house. Test me in this,' says the Lord Almighty, 'and see if I will not throw open the floodgates of heaven and pour out so much blessing that there will not be room enough to store it.'

Remember this: Whoever sows sparingly will also reap sparingly, and whoever sows generously will also reap generously. Each of you should give what you have decided in your heart to give, not reluctantly or under compulsion, for God loves a cheerful giver.
Therefore, I urge you, brothers and sisters, in view of God's mercy, to offer your bodies as a living sacrifice, holy and pleasing to God—this is your true and proper worship.

Monday.scripture: Matthew 20:28: 'Just as the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.'
Monday.action: Identify one way you can serve someone selflessly today without expecting anything in return. This could be helping a coworker, doing a chore for a family member, or volunteering.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me to serve others with a pure heart, just as You served. Remove my selfish tendencies and replace them with a genuine desire to put others first. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Proverbs 11:25: 'A generous person will prosper; whoever refreshes others will themselves be refreshed.'
Tuesday.action: Review your financial giving. Are you giving out of obligation or joy? Consider setting up an automatic tithe or increasing your current giving.
Tuesday.prayer: God, transform my heart to be a cheerful giver. Help me see my resources as tools to bless others and advance Your kingdom. Reveal any areas of financial selfishness. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Luke 6:38: 'Give, and it will be given to you. A good measure, pressed down, shaken together and running over, will be poured into your lap.'
Wednesday.action: Look for an opportunity to give something unexpected - whether it's money, time, encouragement, or resources.
Wednesday.prayer: Heavenly Father, open my eyes to opportunities for generosity. Help me give without reservation, trusting in Your abundant provision. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Acts 20:35: 'In everything I did, I showed you that by this kind of hard work we must help the weak, remembering the words the Lord Jesus himself said: 'It is more blessed to give than to receive.''
Thursday.action: Volunteer for a ministry or community service project. If time is limited, commit to a random act of kindness.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, make me an instrument of Your love and service. Help me see opportunities to serve and meet the needs of others around me. Amen.

Friday.scripture: 1 Peter 4:10: 'Each of you should use whatever gift you have received to serve others, as faithful stewards of God's grace in its various forms.'
Friday.action: Take a spiritual gifts assessment and research how you can use your gifts to serve in your church or community.
Friday.prayer: God, reveal the unique gifts You've given me. Show me how I can use these gifts to glorify You and bless others. Give me courage to step out in service. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Galatians 5:13: 'You, my brothers and sisters, were called to be free. But do not use your freedom to indulge the flesh; rather, serve one another humbly in love.'
Saturday.action: Reflect on areas where pride might prevent you from serving. Identify and commit to addressing these areas.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, humble my heart. Remove any pride that keeps me from serving others. Help me see serving as a privilege, not a burden. Amen.
